_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Risk Management Plan Executive Summary

Facility:Trotter Fertilizer
City:Ansley, NE
Contact:Tim Kraus
Phone:308-935-1100


1.Faciltiy Policy.

    The owners, management, and employees of Trotter Fertilizer are committed to prevention of any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia. If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the local fire department and other authorities to mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to persons and the environment.

2.Facility Information.

    Trotter Grain and Fertilizer is a small independent retail facility of plant food and crop protection chemicals. Anhydrous ammonia is received, stored, and distributed for direct application as a fertilizer for crop production. 

3.Accidental Release Prevention Program.

    This faciltiy is in compliance with the provisions of "Safety Requirements for the Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia K-61.1", published by The American National Standards Institute, In.,(ANSI), and the Standards of the U.S.Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910,111, "Storage and Registration Form, see Section 8.3 (b).

4.Five-year Accidental History.

    There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the last five years that have caused any deaths, injuries, or significant property damage.

5.Emergency Response Program.

    The facility has:
       a. A written action plan, in accordance with OSHA standard 29 CFR 1910.38.

       b. Provided state and local authorities with the emergency planning and community right-to-know information as requird under SARA III (EPCRA).

6.Planned Changes to Improve Safety.

    Safety improvements are an on-going process at this facility. Periodic evaluations are performed to assess the maintenance and safe conditions of our equipment. There are no additional specific anhydrous ammonia safety recommendations at this time.

7.For futher information contact: Tim Kraus at 308-935-1100.
